description: Smallest prime starting a sequence of 2n consecutive odd primes with symmetrical gaps about the center.
links: Discussion at the scientific forum dxdy.ru, Distributed computing project (in Russian)
example: The first term is 3 since the 2 primes 3, 5 have a gap of 2, which is trivially symmetric about its center.The second term is 5 since the 4 primes 5, 7, 11, 13 have gaps 2, 4, 2, which is symmetric about its center.The twelve primes 137, 139, 149, 151, 157, 163, 167, 173, 179, 181, 191, 193 have gaps 2, 10, 2, 6, 6, 4, 6, 6, 2, 10, 2 - symmetric about the middle, so a(6) = 137.
author: _Jud McCranie_, Jun 23 2000
extensions: Minor edits by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 02 2010
a(11) from _Dmitry Petukhov_, added by _Max Alekseyev_, Aug 08 2014
a(12) from an anonymous participant of the project, added by _Max Alekseyev_, Jul 21 2015
